Hey riot, I was thinking of a pretty cool idea but that's only my opinion. A nice and cool feature everyone could have would be to customize their own champ border when you enter into the loading screen.
To be able to do this gives everyone a sense of "wow & that's cool" feel.
But what this also can do (I think) is that it can potentially up peoples way of playing the game, as in a more positive attitude to the game and to see everyone else's borders on their loading screen and be like "That's awesome". It brings out that creativity in everyone and can make people feel a lot more better about themselves in and out of the game.
This could also motivate peoples minds to really tune into this game and just play heaps. (this is only what I think)
But not just people that play the game but also people who don't. People who see this can see this as a cool thing, and interactive feature which can possibly attract a lot more people and gamers particularly to just play this game.
But of course to customize a border for a specific champion this would obviously cost Influence points (IP) to get different types of designs and various little shapes and all.
But rare and cool looking features and designs could cost riot points (RP) and can also possibly be in the hextech crafting for randoms.
But then again this is what I think you guys can or could do. It has many benefits in my mind but you guys might have a fair bit of negatives about this but again I think this is a great idea and this can be awesome for others to do.
Lhuka.
P.S - This could make money (COULD)

I think you'll find the people pointing out the cost of 'purchasing' gemstones were more outlining that it's literally impossible for a player who doesn't purchase RP to obtain the hextech skins - they weren't as such complaining about them not being 'directly purchasable'. 
I seen a video recently where 250+ boxes were needed. Assuming you somehow magically get a box or key fragment every single game, this totals to **1,000 games** for a single Hextech skin. Once you factor in not receiving a box or key every game and the realistic figure is more around 3,000-4,000+.
